statement:
Let $x_1,x_2,\ldots,x_n$ be positive numbers. Then $$\begin{aligned}
\max\{x_1,x_2,\ldots,x_n\} &\ge& \frac{x_1+x_2+\cdots+x_n}{n}\\
&\ge& \sqrt[n]{x_1 x_2\cdots x_n} \\
&\ge& \frac{n}{\frac{1}{x_1}+\frac{1}{x_2}+\cdots+\frac{1}{x_n}}\\
&\ge& \min\{x_1,x_2,\ldots,x_n\}\end{aligned}$$

The equality is obtained if and only if $x_1=x_2=\cdots = x_n$.

There are several generalizations to this inequality using power means
and weighted power means.
